display_title.display_title:
Algérie : Projet d’urgence de
            réhabilitation et de réduction de la vulnérabilité en zone
            urbaine : évaluation de l’impact environnemental (Vol. 2) :
            Plan cadre de gestion environnementale (version préliminaire)

docna.cdata!:
Plan cadre de gestion environnementale
            (version preliminaire)

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Urban Natural Hazard
            Vulnerability Reduction Project : environmental impact assessment

0.cdata!:
Disaster prevention; Emergency management;
            Natural disasters; Resettlement; Drainage systems

admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Natural Hazard Vulnerability
            Reduction Project will strengthen its national capacity for
            disaster management, and reduce urban vulnerability to
            natural hazards. The project's long term impact is
            considered to be essentially positive and will lead to a
            significantly lower vulnerability in the area. The
            environmental impacts of the works involved by the Project
            will be minimal and will be addressed in detail in the
            integrated vulnerability reduction study. The resettlement
            of 5,000 families currently living in areas vulnerable to
            natural hazards is the most serious issue and was analyzed
            very carefully. The new sites for resettlement of the 5,000
            families will be subjected to environmental screening and
            environmental management plans will be prepared as needed to
            ensure that appropriate mitigation measures will be
            implemented and monitored. The project also aims at
            removing, offsetting, or mitigating all impacts of
            unregulated urban development that magnified the adverse
            consequences of the flash floods of November 10, 2001. This
            will be done through works to be carried out on the
            concerned watersheds and embankments, and will include slope
            stabilization by tree plantations, retention basins, and
            drainage collectors.
